exercises.title: Match Greetings to Situations
exercises.instructions: Match each greeting with the appropriate situation.

questions.explanation: გამარჯობა works for hello at any time. ნახვამდის means goodbye. დილა მშვიდობისა is good morning, and საღამო მშვიდობისა is good evening.

exercises.title: Understanding Formal Address
exercises.instructions: Choose the correct answer about formal address in Georgian.

questions.question: When should you use 'ბატონო' (Batono)?
questions.explanation: ბატონო (Batono) is used when addressing a man formally, equivalent to 'Mr.' or 'Sir' in English. It shows respect.

questions.question: What is the female equivalent of 'ბატონო'?
questions.explanation: ქალბატონო (Kalbatono) is the formal address for a woman, equivalent to 'Mrs.' or 'Madam'.

questions.question: When would you use formal address in Georgia?

options.text: Only with strangers and in professional settings

questions.explanation: Formal address (ბატონო/ქალბატონო) is used with strangers, in professional settings, and when showing respect. It's an important part of Georgian etiquette.

exercises.title: Complete the Greetings
exercises.instructions: Fill in the blanks with the correct greeting phrase.

questions.question: Complete: _____ (hello), როგორ ხართ?
questions.explanation: გამარჯობა means 'hello' and can be used in any situation.

questions.question: Complete: _____ (goodbye), გმადლობთ!
questions.explanation: ნახვამდის means 'goodbye' - literally 'until we see (each other)'.

questions.question: Complete: _____ (thank you very much) თქვენი დახმარებისთვის!
questions.explanation: დიდი მადლობა means 'thank you very much' - didi means 'big' or 'great'.

exercises.title: Expressions of Gratitude
exercises.instructions: Answer questions about saying thank you in Georgian.

questions.question: What is the appropriate response to 'მადლობა' (thank you)?
questions.explanation: არაფერს means 'you're welcome' or literally 'nothing' - it's the standard polite response to thank you.

questions.question: What does 'დიდი მადლობა' literally mean?
questions.explanation: დიდი means 'big' or 'great', so დიდი მადლობა literally means 'big thanks' or 'thank you very much'.

exercises.title: Pronunciation Practice: Greetings
exercises.instructions: Listen and repeat each greeting. Focus on proper pronunciation.

questions.explanation: Practice: ga-mar-jo-ba. This is the most important greeting you'll use every day!
Practice: nakh-vam-dis. Literally means 'until we see (each other)'.
Practice: mad-lo-ba. Essential for showing gratitude in Georgia!
Practice: ba-to-no. Use this when addressing a man formally.

exercises.title: Translation Practice
exercises.instructions: Translate these common phrases between Georgian and English.

questions.question: Translate to Georgian: 'Hello, how are you?' (formal)
questions.explanation: გამარჯობა means hello, and როგორ ხართ? is the formal 'how are you?' (ხართ is formal, ხარ is informal).

questions.question: Translate to English: 'ნახვამდის, დიდი მადლობა'
questions.explanation: ნახვამდის means goodbye, and დიდი მადლობა means thank you very much.
